The Data & Insights team’s mission is to transform Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.

About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst at Trustly, you will look at the breadth of our data with a statistical mindset. Through your analytics skills and proficiency in handling data, you will uncover patterns and provide data-driven answers to complex strategic challenges. Depending on the stakeholder’s requests, you will choose adequate solutions to present your insights, ranging from dashboards in our BI tool to deep-dive analysis. In close collaboration with our data foundation team, you will be involved in building a strong and reliable data foundation that will support the analytics needs.


What you’ll do
  • Taking ownership of entire analytical projects, from defining objectives with our business stakeholders to delivering actionable insights and recommendations
  • Perform in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business growth and efficiency
  • Choose adequate analytical methods and tools to convey complex findings in a clear and concise manner
  • Continuously contribute to improve our Analytics capabilities 
  • Actively participate in establishing the data-driven culture at Trustly


Who you are
  • A Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or similar field
  • At least 3 years of experience within the analytics field, experience with the payments industry is a plus
  • Having a high degree of autonomy and being able to work independently on complex analyses
  • Solid and broad analytical skills-set including the ability to use statistical methods
  • Solid SQL and Python skills
  • Experience working with BI tools such as QlikSense or Tableau
  • Excellent communication skills 
  • Thrive in in a fast growing company



Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.

If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and kindly submit your CV in English.

Title: Associate Product Analyst
Description:
Do you love music & data? Do you want a job where you influence the direction of a company on a day-to-day basis? Are you passionate about building out a product that users love? Read more below!

The role

Join our dynamic and innovative B2B music streaming company as a Product Analyst, contributing to the success of our product teams. We're passionate about revolutionizing the way businesses experience and leverage music, and we're looking for a skilled analyst to help drive data-driven insights for our product optimization and growth strategies.

As a growing scale-up, we expect your footprint to be big! You will be central to building an insights-led culture within product development, working tightly with our engineers to turn customer experiences and data into insights, gain a deep understanding of the customer journey, and help drive the strategy and guide on where efforts are worth the most.

Responsibilities


Build and analyze A/B tests in our product and on our systems
Present findings technical and non-technical stakeholders across the business
Support our product teams in product planning, evaluation, and feature optimization
Evaluate user journeys to optimize the product and listening experiences of our customers
Provide guidance to the engineering team so that product changes are adequately tracked to provide data to evaluate measures of success
Ensure that product decisions are financially sustainable, having a positive impact on user acquisition, retention, and margins


About You

Just like us, you love music. You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.

Role

We believe that for you to be successful in the role, you should be able to tick at least a majority of the boxes below:


At least 1-4 years of experience working with data and insights, ideally as a product analyst or related role
Technical curiosity and proven ability to learn and adapt to new technologies and skills
Knowledge of SQL (Excel/Sheets or Python are a plus!)
Experience with BigQuery and Google Cloud
Statistical modeling, experimentation, and A/B testing
Familiarity with machine learning and model evaluation
Experience in creating dashboards and visualizations using BI tools (bonus if Tableau or Mixpanel)
Ability to communicate data and insights in a business context language
Knowledge of qualitative UX research methods
An informal leader, unafraid to challenge the status quo or offer new ideas
Passion for details
Fluent in English


About Us

Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.

Employee Benefits


Our office is in Vasastan in Stockholm, though we have a flexible work-from-home or office policy
Generous pension plan
Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription.
Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
Daily breakfast served at the office


If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to hiring manager Steven Jordan (steven@soundtrack.io).
Show more

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Vi söker en driven Data Quality Analyst till området Data Quality inom Wholesale Solutions med inriktning på Spårbarhet.

Vi söker dig som brinner för masterdatafrågor och som har dokumenterad erfarenhet från tidigare arbete inom Masterdata där du haft en senior roll. Vidare tror vi att du har förståelse och intresse för datakvalitet och betydelsen av data i flödeskedjan tvärs organisationer samt förstår samspelet mellan verksamheten och IT-stöd. Du talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.

Som Data Quality Analyst är du driven och har lätt för att samarbeta och har förmågan att representera Data Quality i stora projekt som har påverkan på Masterdata inom ICA. Kompetens inom spårbarhetsområdet är önskvärt men inget krav.

Vi ser även att du använder självledarskapet i vardagen och är förändringsbenägen med ett fokus på att ständigt förbättra arbetssätt och processer.

Så här arbetar en Data Quaity Analyst

Förvalta, utveckla och säkerställa hög kvalitet i masterdataprocesser utifrån ett dataperspektiv samt de data assets som faller inom rollens ansvar.

I samarbete med verksamheten och Digital & Technology samla in och hantera krav för de tekniska och funktionella lösningar som återfinns inom ICAs masterdataprocesser.

Initiera förändringar och driva ständiga förbättringar av masterdatas dataprocesser och masterdatahantering.

Tillsammans med Data Quality Key User och Digital & Technology hantera avancerad felsökning och komplicerad utredning av incidenter gällande data assets, processer och verktyg.

Säkra att relevant dokumentation av dataprocess skapas och löpande underhålls, samt att kontinuerliga utbildningsåtgärder verkar för att tillgodose verksamhetens behov av kompetens inom masterdataområdet.

Tillföra hög masterdatakompetens i projekt och arbetsgrupper som kräver avancerad kompetens inom data och därmed säkra att förändrade eller nyutvecklade masterdataprocesser eller verktyg verkar för ”Best Practice” inom Masterdata Management.

Tillsammans med andra Masterdataexperter säkra effektivt utnyttjande av tillgängliga standarder och uppsatta policys för hantering av ICAs masterdata.

Via ett engagerat självledarskap och nyfikenhet verka för att rollens kompetens ligger i linje med ICAs aktuella behov på kort och lång sikt.

Vad händer nu?

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och tillträde till tjänsten sker enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande, så du är välkommen att skicka in din ansökan omgående. Vi reserverar oss för att tillsättning av tjänsten kan ske innan sista dagen för ansökan går ut.

Anställning:

Tillsvidare med tillträde snarast

Placeringsort:

Solna/Göteborg/Helsingborg

Kontaktperson:

Kajsa Fägerblad Area Manager Data Quality, ICA Sverige AB, tfn: +46722202154

Sista dag för ansökan:

2025-02-28

ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (CRM Specialist) - Temporary Role for 13 months
Description:
Company Description


Please note that this is an temporary role for 13 months**



Sales is a global function within the H&M brand, dedicated to growing and engaging our customer base while developing our sales channels. By integrating business and digital & tech expertise, Sales plays a crucial role in delivering our brand plan—elevating H&M through product, experience, and brand, offering aspirational fashion at unbeatable prices.

The Customer Activation unit in Sales aims to bring our brand direction to life through various touchpoints. Utilizing data and customer insights, we design plans to ensure a holistic customer experience, from communication to our membership program.

In the Insights and Development team, we are passionate about leveraging data to enhance customer relationships and drive business growth. As a CRM Specialist, you will shape our data-driven strategies and optimize our CRM toolbox.

Job Description

Position Overview

We seek a candidate with strong data analysis and insights skills. The ideal candidate will have a solid background in data analysis, strong business acumen, and a passion for analyzing customer data, extracting meaningful insights, and leveraging those insights to drive CRM strategies and tactics. You will work closely with cross-functional global teams to extract insights from customer data, develop future use cases, and drive business growth through our CRM toolbox.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze customer data to identify trends, patterns, and business opportunities for CRM strategy improvements.
Collaborate with the global CRM team and the Value Stream Activate to drive strategy work, customer journey automation, future CRM use cases, and hypotheses for A/B tests.
Business analysis-contribute to weekly, monthly and quarterly follow up on business performance from a CRM and customer data perspective.
Follow-up of global triggered customer journeys and leverage these insights in journey optimization.
Guide the regions and serve as the point of contact for all CRM reports and KPIs.
Create and maintain data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Prioritize and develop CRM report package and other data products on GCP.



Qualifications


Academic degree in Business Administration, Economics, or a related field.
Previous experience in data analysis.
Genuine interest in creating business value from data.
Experience working with large data sets and complex business problems.
Proficiency in SQL.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and present findings to non-technical stakeholders.
A team player who enjoys sharing knowledge with colleagues.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a structured and thorough manner.



Preferred Qualifications


Previous experience working with customer data.
Business understanding within the field of CRM.
Experience with cloud analytics environments such as GCP.



If you are passionate about data, eager to make a difference, and thrive in a dynamic, data-driven environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Additional Information

This is a temporary position with placement in Stockholm in the Pegasus office. If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.

Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We look forward to receiving your application!

H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age. We strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Therefore, we kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases.

Kindly do not send applications to this email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.
Show more

Title: E-commerce & Data Analyst Intern
Description:
At DeoDoc, we are revolutionizing intimate care with innovative, gynecologist-developed products designed for women’s health. Join our team in Stockholm and contribute to shaping the future of intimate wellness.




We’re looking for a creative and data-driven intern to support our E-commerce and marketing efforts. You’ll have the opportunity to work on email marketing, website management, performance analytics, digital design, and more!




What You’ll Do




Assist in email marketing campaigns and customer engagement strategies.
Optimize website performance and customer experience.
Analyze sales data, website traffic & customer behavior to uncover insights.
Develop reports & dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Support A/B testing and campaign performance analysis.
Create digital assets (graphics, images) to enhance brand communication.
Collaborate with the social media team to drive traffic and conversions.
Assist the creative team with photoshoots & content creation.




Who You Are




Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Communications, or related field.
Passionate about E-commerce, consumer behavior, and digital marketing.
Strong analytical skills and interest in performance optimization.
Familiarity with Google Analytics, Shopify, or Adobe Creative Suite is a plus.
Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus).
A creative problem-solver who loves working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Why Join Us?




Get real-world experience.
Work in an innovative and supportive team in the heart of Stockholm.
Make a direct impact in the fast-growing space of women’s intimate health.




Location: Stockholm

Duration: 3-6 months (Part-time or Full-time)

Compensation: Paid

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Map Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!







Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Swedish.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Sweden.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Sweden for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Lead, Corporate & Investment Banking | SEB, Stockholm
Description:
Would you like to help SEB Corporate & Investment Banking (CIB) division to reach our aspiration of becoming data driven and create value and insights from data? Are you excited about the process of creating and managing data and using it for Analytics and insights? Do you have the skills to work hands on with data while seeing the bigger picture, setting the strategic direction and actively work towards it? We are now looking for a Data Analyst Lead to join CIB Data and Analytics Office.

CIB Data & Analytics Office is a department within CIB CIO, driving dialogue with SEB Group, Analytics, and IT teams. We support new capabilities like cloud technology, data management & analytics toolkit, process digitalization and regulatory initiatives.

Master Data and Analytics Office is a team within CIB Data & Analytics Office with the mission to leverage the value in data and helping CIB becoming data driven by making sure high-quality data is available and used to create value for the business and our customers.

About the role:

This is a great opportunity to combine your analytic skills with people management and leadership skills. You will collaborate with stakeholders from all parts of SEB to make sure that short-term and long-term objectives are met.

Key responsibilities:


Collaborate with business units to provide data visualization and insights.
Analyze data to improve process efficiency.
Assist in gathering and structuring data for projects.
Develop analytical capabilities, reports, and validations.
Involve in the entire data value chain.
Promote the use of high-quality data.
Lead and mentor team members e.g. priorities, drive use cases and secure operational structure.
Coordinate and lead an analytics community within Master Data Area.


To thrive in this role, we believe you have:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or equivelent.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, BigQuery, Tableau, Excel, or similar tools.
Strong analytical skills to turn data into actionable insights.
Ability to simplify complex questions and work with stakeholders.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, especially BigQuery, is a plus.
Knowledge of business development processes and the financial sector.
Ability to bridge IT and business.
Strong personal drive and change leadership experience.
Excellent collaboration, communication, and presentation skills.
Fluency in English.
Proven leadership skills to inspire and guide teams.
Strong interpersonal skills for effective relationships.
Experience in leading and mentoring teams.
Ability to drive data literacy and best practices.
Strong decision-making and multitasking abilities.
Commitment to continuous improvement.


What we offer:

SEB CIB offers an attractive and international learning environment. We aim to attract exceptional individuals with a desire to grow their own skillset as well as provide exceptional service to their clients. You will work side by side with a diverse team of experienced colleagues and get the chance to build strong network internally as well as externally.

Do you want to be part of SEB?

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 20 February 2025. Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to Data and Analytics Office and our mission of making CIB data driven.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Stephanie Crane, Head of Master Data and Analytics Office & Data Transformation on +46 70 739 11 78 or stephanie.crane@seb.se . We will not process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.

https://sebgroup.com/career

https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

CIB Data & Analytics Office is a department within CIB CIO, driving dialogue with SEB Group, Analytics, and IT teams. We support new capabilities like cloud technology, data management & analytics toolkit, process digitalization and regulatory initiatives.

Title: Junior analytiker/konsult inom media och telekom
Description:
MEDIAVISION växer och söker en junior analytiker/konsult




Är du en nyfiken och driven person med en utpräglad analytisk förmåga och ett brinnande intresse för mediebranschen? Befinner du dig i början av din karriär och letar efter en tjänst med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter? Mediavision söker nu en junior analytiker/ konsult för en heltidstjänst till vårt kontor i Stockholm.




Om Mediavision

Mediavision startade 1996, är baserat i Stockholm och med Norden i fokus. Vi är strategi- och affärsutvecklingskonsulter inom medieindustrin. Vi hjälper företag att utvecklas genom datadriven marknadsinsikt och business intelligence. Vår rådgivning tar sin utgångspunkt i unik egen data och empiri – med en genuin förståelse för medieindustrins ekosystem och villkor som bas.

Våra kunder är framför allt telekomoperatörer och mediehus inom TV/rörlig bild, online, print, musik med mera. Flera av våra kunder är också internationella aktörer med stort intresse för Norden och nordiska bolag. Vi som arbetar på Mediavision är huvudsakligen civilingenjörer och ekonomer – alla med ett brinnande intresse för medieindustrin och dess affärsmöjligheter.




Om tjänsten

Som analytiker/konsult på Mediavision kommer du direkt att få arbeta med projekt som behandlar mediebranschens viktigaste strategiska frågor. Du kommer bli en viktig del i våra löpande marknadsanalyser och skräddarsydda konsultprojekt i takt med att du bekantar dig med både marknaden i stort, och vårt analysunderlag (data). Du kommer få arbeta med att sammanställa och analysera konsument- och marknadsdata och därifrån skapa rapporter och presentationsmaterial. Därigenom kommer du få applicera och utveckla såväl dina matematiska/statistiska som metodologiska, pedagogiska, grafiska och språkliga färdigheter.




Vi söker dig som

·      Har en akademisk examen på minst magisternivå/masternivå inom ekonomi eller teknik (civilingenjör) från en ledande högskola/universitet med mycket goda studieresultat. Exempelvis med inriktning mot management, statistik, medieteknik, nationalekonomi eller industriell ekonomi

·      Har en god förståelse för affärer, marknadskrafter och ekonomiska nyckeltal

·      Har ett uttalat intresse för mediemarknaden

·      Är intresserad av att arbeta med strategiska frågeställningar

·      Är en nyfiken person med en uttalat stark egen drivkraft som vill jobba med likasinnade

·      Har erfarenhet av att jobba med Excel och Power Point

·      Behärskar svenska och engelska mycket väl i tal och skrift

·      Har en god förmåga att samarbeta och skapa förtroendefulla relationer i olika sammanhang




Det är även meriterande om du

·      Har vana att hantera, bearbeta och analysera data

·      Har erfarenhet av programmering eller att jobba med statistikprogram




Låter detta intressant?

Skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till rekrytering@mediavision.se. Vid frågor, kontakta oss på 08-52 80 90 90 eller fredrik.liljeqvist@mediavision.se. Vi kallar till intervju löpande.

Show more

Title: Graduates and Junior Consultants to Accenture Data & AI part of Strategy & Consulting
Description:
Are you a recent graduate or about to graduate from University? Do you see a future career in consulting? Do you believe in the power of data?

Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity! Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!

About Strategy & Consulting - Data & AI

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Accenture S&C Data & AI in Sweden is a group of more than 40 people working on unlocking the power of analytics, data and AI, and pave the way for innovation. Through deep industry expertise, analytics and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on data, technology and business.

Accenture Data & AI is part of Accenture Strategy & Consulting, which consists of a wide range of business functions and industry groups. Read more about our business functions and industries here.

About the role as Data & AI Analyst within Accenture Strategy & Consulting

In your role as Data & AI Analyst at Accenture, you could:



Develop innovative solutions for clients with a focus on Data, Data Visualization, Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Generative AI


Develop and strengthen your skills within our three job families, Data & AI Value Strategy, Data Science & Machine Learning and Vizualization & Interaction Science


Design and implement tools and methods to efficiently retrieve, manage, communicate and visualize large amounts of data


Help clients to develop methods and tools to generate data-driven insights to further develop operations, identify and unlock new value


Analyze, design and deliver next-generation digital architecture to meet changing business needs and enable new digital business models


Educate clients and users in methods, market trends, tools and functionality linked to Analytics, AI and Machine Learning



What’s in it for you:



Great development opportunities to start building your professional career


A chance to truly match your ingenuity with the latest technology to make incredible things


Extensive training to develop your business acumen, technical and professional skills including on-the-job learning and formal training


Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization - including methodology, knowledge databases, expert networks and benchmarks


A dedicated mentor who helps you define career goals and supports you in achieving your goals and your full potential


A very strong team culture among supportive colleagues, where team spirit and cooperation are highly valued and rewarded


Over time, you will also be introduced to leadership responsibilities



Who we are looking for:



You have a master's degree and/or will receive your degree within one year of applying


You can start in late August/September 2025


You have proven strong academic results in a relevant field


You are an analytical problem-solver with strong business acumen


You have a basic understanding of data literacy - we want you to feel comfortable handling and analyzing data as well as being curious about its capabilities


You are ambitious, driven, solution-oriented and eager to start your career in an advisory role


You have excellent written and oral presentation skills


You are fluent in English. Swedish is beneficial but not required



Location

We are looking for graduates to join our offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg and Malmö.

The application and interview process

We look forward to receiving your application! Please enclose your CV and cover letter together with your university grades with your application. Kindly include GPA in a 5 grade scale. All these documents are required for a complete application. Only complete applications are reviewed. Please specify in your cover letter which office and you are interested in as well as when you want to start. The screening and selection process is ongoing. If your application moves to the next step, you will receive an invitation to take two tests that aim to measure your analytical ability as well as a personality test.

Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

We look forward to receiving your application!


Show more

Title: Business IT Analyst
Description:
Nord Group is seeking a Senior IT Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you’ll play a vital part in bridging the gap between business and IT, driving requirement engineering work.




About the Role

As a Senior IT Analyst, you’ll join the Requirements and Analysis team in the Open Banking Service Domain. Your focus will be on delivering actionable analyses to design innovative solutions that enhance customer experiences.




Key responsibilities include:

Partnering with stakeholders to align business strategies with practical, scalable technical solutions.
Gathering and documenting both functional and non-functional requirements through collaboration with teams like architecture, development, testing, and legal.
Breaking down business goals into actionable technical specifications for IT teams.
Ensuring smooth end-to-end development by maintaining clear requirements traceability.
Producing detailed documentation, including use cases, to support development and quality assurance.
Acting as a liaison for developers and testers, assisting with solution verification and test results analysis.
Providing key stakeholders with insights on solution performance and impact.




What We’re Looking For

We value adaptability, ownership, innovation, and resilience. Here’s what makes you a great fit:

A solid foundation in both technical and business domains, with strong analytical and documentation skills.
Self-motivation, attention to detail, and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Strong communication skills and a proven ability to collaborate in a team-oriented environment.
Familiarity with Agile approaches such as SAFe, Scrum, or Kanban.




Your Experience & Background

To succeed in this role, you should bring:

Relevant experience in IT or business analysis, with exposure to cross-functional projects.
Proficiency in tools like Jira and Confluence.
Knowledge of API development, process mapping, and data modeling.
Practical expertise in SQL, user interface design, and architectural diagrams (e.g., sequence diagrams).
An understanding of the banking sector, especially within payments.
Strong English language skills and experience working in international teams.




What's on Offer:

A competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities to contribute to transformative projects in the financial sector.
A hybrid working model, with flexibility across various European locations.

Show more

Title: Informationsarkitekt - Data & Analytics
Description:
Arbetsuppgifter


Utveckla begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller
Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance


Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. När du tar initiativ, vågar utmana, prova nytt och utveckla vår verksamhet kommer du också att utvecklas. Det händer att våra medarbetare växer ur sin roll och kliver in i en annan. På så sätt blir din drivkraft utvecklingsmöjligheter både för dig och för oss. Låter det bra? Välkommen!

Att jobba som Informationsarkitekt

Som Informationsarkitekt hos Data & Analytics kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att bygga och förädla den grund som vår data- och informationshantering vilar på. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi organiserar och strukturerar vår information, vilket är avgörande för vår förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut och skapa värde för våra kunder. Genom att utveckla avancerade begrepps-, informations- och datamodeller, samt leda workshops och analyser, kommer du att säkerställa att vi har en tydlig och effektiv informationsstruktur. Ditt arbete med att skapa och underhålla dokumentation samt ansvara för masterdata och relaterade processer kommer att vara centralt för vår Data & analytics-avdelning. Dessutom kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i vårt arkitekturstyrningsarbete och fungera som en drivande kraft i implementeringen av vår Data governance-strategi.

Om detta låter intressant, då är det dags att bli en del av vårt team! SBAB välkomnar dig till en växande Data & analytics-avdelning. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

Vi ser gärna att du:


Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.


Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Har du check på allt?


Analytisk
Helhetsperspektiv
Initiativtagande
Kommunikativ
Strukturerad


Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.
Show more
HTML:
Arbetsuppgifter

  • Utveckla begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller
  • Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
  • Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance

Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. När du tar initiativ, vågar utmana, prova nytt och utveckla vår verksamhet kommer du också att utvecklas. Det händer att våra medarbetare växer ur sin roll och kliver in i en annan. På så sätt blir din drivkraft utvecklingsmöjligheter både för dig och för oss. Låter det bra? Välkommen!

Att jobba som Informationsarkitekt

Som Informationsarkitekt hos Data & Analytics kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att bygga och förädla den grund som vår data- och informationshantering vilar på. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi organiserar och strukturerar vår information, vilket är avgörande för vår förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut och skapa värde för våra kunder. Genom att utveckla avancerade begrepps-, informations- och datamodeller, samt leda workshops och analyser, kommer du att säkerställa att vi har en tydlig och effektiv informationsstruktur. Ditt arbete med att skapa och underhålla dokumentation samt ansvara för masterdata och relaterade processer kommer att vara centralt för vår Data & analytics-avdelning. Dessutom kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i vårt arkitekturstyrningsarbete och fungera som en drivande kraft i implementeringen av vår Data governance-strategi.

Om detta låter intressant, då är det dags att bli en del av vårt team! SBAB välkomnar dig till en växande Data & analytics-avdelning. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

Vi ser gärna att du:

  • Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
  • Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
  • Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
  • Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
  • Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.

Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Har du check på allt?

  • Analytisk
  • Helhetsperspektiv
  • Initiativtagande
  • Kommunikativ
  • Strukturerad

Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about information hidden in data, programming, and finance?

In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:


Leverage your analytical skills to identify and predict customer needs, driving proactive sales and personalized communication towards the corporate segment in Swedbank’s Swedish business.
Utilize your programming and statistical skills to develop models that drive business growth in retail banking.
Work in an analytical team close to operations and be a part of the full analytical process, from identifying business opportunities to developing and deploying models, as well as creating data driven initiatives.
Perform detailed analyses on large datasets and provide management with actionable, data-driven insights that support strategic decision-making.
Understand how operational processes and policies impact key performance indicators (KPIs) across various business disciplines.
Collaborate with colleagues to demonstrate how process changes can lead to improved outcomes.



What is needed in this role:


A creative and problem-solving mindset as well as an ambition to make a difference.
A fundamental understanding of areas in data science (statistics and machine learning)
An interest in corporate retail banking and how a corporate customer’s needs and challenges change throughout life stages
An understanding of the product portfolio within a retail bank.
Excellent communication skill to be able to convey ideas and analytical results effectively verbally and in writing to a non-technical audience.
University degree in a technical field such as statistics, mathematics, economics, or engineering
Experience working with practical applications of statistical modelling/machine learning.
Experience programming within an analytical framework (e.g. R / Python / SAS) and experience using SQL or spark.



What we offer when you join us:


An open, simple and caring culture
Opportunity to create the best experience for our customers
An international, sustainable and inclusive work environment
Development opportunities and advancement in your career
Flexible working options
Access to Group performance program, company pension plan, optional health insurance, and other benefits



"Join our team and...

be a part of an international team of professionals, who are jointly delivering challenging projects, maximizing customer value and increasing Swedbank’s competitive advantage”. Rikard Eriksson, your future manager

We look forward to receiving your application by 15.02.2025.

Location: Sundbyberg

Recruiting manager: Rikard Eriksson

We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.

We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.

Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.


Show more

Title: Open application
Description:
Are you a forward-thinking, innovative, and motivated individual looking to join a dynamic team of professionals? Solita is excited to invite applications for various positions within our rapidly growing organization. As a leading digital transformation and consulting company, Solita is committed to helping businesses harness the power of data, AI, and digital technologies to achieve their goals.

Solita is a Nordic leader in digital transformation, offering a comprehensive range of services that empower organizations to thrive in the digital age. With a strong focus on innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning, Solita is dedicated to creating impactful solutions that drive real results for our clients.

Why Join Solita


Innovative Environment: At Solita, we foster a culture of innovation and encourage our employees to think outside the box. Your ideas and creativity will be valued and nurtured.
Professional Growth: We are committed to the professional development of our team members. You'll have access to ongoing training, workshops, and opportunities to expand your skill set.
Diverse Projects: Solita Sweden works with a wide range of clients across various industries, providing you with the chance to work on diverse and exciting projects that challenge and stimulate your intellect.
Collaborative Culture: Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. You'll be working alongside experts in various fields, providing you with a unique chance to learn and grow together.
Flexible Work Environment: We understand the importance of work-life balance. Solita offers flexible work arrangements that allow you to manage your professional and personal commitments effectively.



Positions Available

We are currently open to applications for a variety of roles, including but not limited to:


Data Engineer
Software Developer
Cloud Native Developer
Integration Engineer/Architect
Visual Analytics Consultant
Integration Lead
Cloud DevOps Engineer
Enterprise Architect
Information Architect



Requirements

The specific requirements for each role may vary, but in general, we are seeking candidates who possess:


Relevant education and experience in the respective field.
Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for finding innovative solutions.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Adaptability and a willingness to learn in a fast-paced environment.



How To Apply

If you're excited about the prospect of joining Solita Sweden and contributing to our mission of digital transformation, we'd love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you're interested in joining Solita.

Join us at Solita Sweden and be part of a team that's shaping the future of digital transformation. Your skills, ideas, and dedication will play a crucial role in driving our success and that of our clients.

Solita is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
Be a productive member of the team.


Requirements


Own end-to-end development, optimization, and support of both existing and new data products, ensuring alignment with the defined target vision.
Champion a DevOps mindset, managing CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) infrastructure.
Ensure that data products operate as independent deployment units, adhering to security, scalability, observability, and performance standards.
Collaborate closely with the Product Manager and stakeholders to shape the vision for existing data products and identify opportunities for new data-driven solutions.
Engage with product teams across domains to drive data mesh adoption.
Continuously evaluate, optimize, and reduce technical debt to enhance system performance and efficiency.
Stay up to date with emerging data, analytics, and cloud technologies to drive innovation.
Passion for data, technology, and problem-solving.
4+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer working with GCP or modern cloud-based data platforms.
Strong expertise in cloud technologies and infrastructure.
Hands-on experience with GCP tools such as DBT and BigQuery.
Proficiency in data query languages (SQL or similar) and working with various data formats (Parquet, Avro).
Experience with data-centric programming using Python, Java, or Scala.
Solid understanding of data modeling techniques and their trade-offs.
Familiarity with both NoSQL and RDBMS databases.


Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.
Opportunities for learning where needed.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Northmill Bank is a pioneering financial institution at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience, digital yet personal.

Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 170 employees in 4 countries, 2.500 merchants and 600.000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a 100% cloud-based product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products.

Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey!

About Our Tech Stack



Snowflake
DBT
AWS
Fivetran
ThoughtSpot



About The Role

As a Data Engineer at Northmill Bank you will be part of the entire data lifecycle, from extracting raw data from its sources, loading it into Snowflake and then transforming/modeling the data to fit final business requirements. You will be a part of the cross-functional Credit & Analytics team consisting of Data Scientists and Analysts who serve the whole bank in terms of data for insights, predictive modeling, reporting and all other potential use cases.

Responsibilities



Collaborate on building and maintaining our full ELT pipeline, including connecting to various data sources using custom AWS Lambdas and/or Fivetran connectors.
Utilize DBT to model and transform data, ensuring it's clean, structured, and ready for analysis, reporting and other operational systems.
Continuously monitor and optimize data flows to proactively drive us forward.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in data engineering.



Qualifications



2+ years of experience in a data engineering role
Proficiency in SQL/Snowflake, DBT and Python.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Experience with cloud platforms, especially AWS, is a plus.
Have an interest in the underlying business and it’s data needs.



Fun Facts



Work-life balance - hit the gym two minutes away or go for a jog in the city.
Event - highly appreciated “Northchill”
Health - 5000 kr health care allowance
Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday.
Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office.
Stockholm's most beautiful office space, right in the city center with incredible views and our very own roof top terrace.



Apply today and be a part of Northmill!

Northmill is a tech company with a banking license aiming to improve financial life, offer merchants smart solutions and erase the borders between in-store and online.

Northmill creates a more personal and relevant experience for people and companies, helping more than 2,500 merchants and 600,000 end users.

Saved for users 31 MSEK

Trustpilot 4.6 of 5

Cloud 100 %

End users 600 000
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description


Build new data products on GCP using DBT and BigQuery
Sync data from multiple sources using Cloud Functions and Python
Orchestrate different components and data pipelines parts with Terraform and Cloud Workflows
Collaborate with other Data Engineers/Scientists along with Software Engineers to solve the current needs in an optimal way


Tech Stack

GCP (BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Cloud Workflows), DBT (DataForm in use currently), Python, Terraform, Git

Experience

Need an experiences Data Engineer who can work well both independently and along with other data engineers & software engineers. The team is cross-functional team with multiple competences.

Required cloud certification: Not mandatory, but preferred: GCP Cloud

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Gillar du att arbeta med data och vara i framkant gällande nya datatjänster? Då är det här rätt tjänst för dig!

Om tjänsten

Till Ving söker vi en Data Engineer som gillar data, att lära sig nytt och kan utveckla vår dataplattform vidare i Microsoft Azure/Fabric.

Informationen från dataplattfomen på NLTG är strategiskt viktig i flera beslutsprocesser och används inom finans, commercial, marknad m.fl.

Teamet ansvarar för hela kedjan från krav, utveckling, test och leverans till förvaltning och support.

Det viktigaste för oss är inte vilka tekniker du kan idag utan det allra viktigaste är din inställning, nyfikenhet och viljan att lära nytt och bidra till vår utveckling och vår kultur.

Vem vi sökerVi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:



Erfarenhet som Data Engineer/BI utvecklare/DW utvecklare
Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure
Är nyfiken, analytisk och lyhörd för ny teknik
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i DevOps team inkl. CI/CD
Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning
Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


Vår plattform idag

Vi har en blandad teknikstack där nästan alla historiska MS Business Intelligence-plattformar finns representerade. SSIS, SSAS, masterdatasystem och SSRS har migrerats till molnet (Azure) med lift and shift. Vi har även nybyggda delar i Azure Synapse Analytics med notebooks innehållande SQL och Python. Nu står vi inför en resa bort från de äldre teknikerna och in i Microsoft Fabric.

Det är meriterande om du även:



Arbetat med/har intresse för Microsoft Fabric


Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du är nyfiken, analytisk och bra på att kommunicera. Du är en teamspelare som värdesätter teamet och bidrar till teamets framgång. I vårt team har vi en öppen dialog och samarbetar gärna kring lösningar och delar erfarenheter med varandra.

Vi erbjuder

Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö och vi sitter på Kungsholmen i centrala Stockholm med goda kommunikationer. Hos oss får du som anställd unika reseförmåner då vi tycker det är viktigt att du ska få se den produkt som du arbetar med. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!

Övrigt

Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när arbetet tillåter. I den här tjänsten tillämpas beredskap. Våra fina lokaler ligger på Vings huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm.

Intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Och har du ingen färdig ansökan och det är det som står i vägen? Hör av dig ändå med några korta rader, så reder vi ut detaljerna senare.

Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Daniel Dandemar på daniel.dandemar@nltg.com eller mobil: 0709-51 34 70

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Globetrotter, Ving Norge, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.

Vi är ett företag där vi har roligt och bryr oss om varandra med vårt people promise "it should be fun, developing and rewarding doing a good job".

Arbetsområde

IT

Roll: Development

Platser: Stockholm

Remote status

Hybridarbete

Sista ansökningsdag: 8 mars 2025

Kontaktperson: Daniel Dandemar
Show more
HTML:
Gillar du att arbeta med data och vara i framkant gällande nya datatjänster? Då är det här rätt tjänst för dig!

Om tjänsten

Till Ving söker vi en Data Engineer som gillar data, att lära sig nytt och kan utveckla vår dataplattform vidare i Microsoft Azure/Fabric.

Informationen från dataplattfomen på NLTG är strategiskt viktig i flera beslutsprocesser och används inom finans, commercial, marknad m.fl.

Teamet ansvarar för hela kedjan från krav, utveckling, test och leverans till förvaltning och support.

Det viktigaste för oss är inte vilka tekniker du kan idag utan det allra viktigaste är din inställning, nyfikenhet och viljan att lära nytt och bidra till vår utveckling och vår kultur.

Vem vi sökerVi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:


  • Erfarenhet som Data Engineer/BI utvecklare/DW utvecklare
  • Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure
  • Är nyfiken, analytisk och lyhörd för ny teknik
  • Erfarenhet av att arbeta i DevOps team inkl. CI/CD
  • Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning
  • Flytande svenska i tal och skrift

Vår plattform idag

Vi har en blandad teknikstack där nästan alla historiska MS Business Intelligence-plattformar finns representerade. SSIS, SSAS, masterdatasystem och SSRS har migrerats till molnet (Azure) med lift and shift. Vi har även nybyggda delar i Azure Synapse Analytics med notebooks innehållande SQL och Python. Nu står vi inför en resa bort från de äldre teknikerna och in i Microsoft Fabric.

Det är meriterande om du även:


  • Arbetat med/har intresse för Microsoft Fabric

Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du är nyfiken, analytisk och bra på att kommunicera. Du är en teamspelare som värdesätter teamet och bidrar till teamets framgång. I vårt team har vi en öppen dialog och samarbetar gärna kring lösningar och delar erfarenheter med varandra.

Vi erbjuder

Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö och vi sitter på Kungsholmen i centrala Stockholm med goda kommunikationer. Hos oss får du som anställd unika reseförmåner då vi tycker det är viktigt att du ska få se den produkt som du arbetar med. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!

Övrigt

Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när arbetet tillåter. I den här tjänsten tillämpas beredskap. Våra fina lokaler ligger på Vings huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm.

Intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Och har du ingen färdig ansökan och det är det som står i vägen? Hör av dig ändå med några korta rader, så reder vi ut detaljerna senare.

Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Daniel Dandemar på daniel.dandemar@nltg.com eller mobil: 0709-51 34 70

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Globetrotter, Ving Norge, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Title: Konsult inom Business Intelligence
Description:
Jobbeskrivning

Sopra Steria är mitt uppe i en spännande tillväxtresa och söker nu fler kollegor med erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence till vårt Analytics-team i Stockholm.

Inom Analytics tar vi oss an spännande, utvecklande och innovativa uppdrag där vi hjälper våra kunder på deras resa mot att bli datadrivna. Vi är en helhetsleverantör som stöttar våra kunder oavsett vart de är på sin resa, i allt från att definiera strategier för att bli mer datadrivna till att bygga DW-lösningar och visualiseringar i BI-verktyg till att leverera avancerade analyser med hjälp av tex AI/ML.

Om rollen

I rollen som Business Intelligence-konsult kommer du att bidra i något av våra spännande kunduppdrag. Vi har gedigen erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence och har nationellt ett team bestående av ett 50-tal erfarna stjärnor. Vi söker dig som vill bidra i allt från att hjälpa våra kunder definiera sina behov till att bygga grymma lösningar och agera som en trusted advisor och verkligen säkerställa att vi levererar rätt värde till kunden.

Om dig

För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har ett antal års erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence, där du har varit med i olika delar av processen för att framställa insikter av data, med hands-on erfarenhet. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet eller intresse av exempelvis affärsutveckling, sälj, kundansvar eller motsvarande. Har du tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult eller med cloudlösningar såsom Azure så är det ett plus.

Kompetenser:


Har en relevant högskoleutbildning
Minst tre års erfarenhet inom området för Business Intelligence, exempelvis: som DW-utvecklare/Data Engineer/Power BI utvecklare
Du har flytande språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


Meriterande, om du har erfarenheter av;


Erfarenhet inom Microsoft-stacken, exempelvis Power BI, MS SQL Server, Azure
Tidigare erfarenhet som konsult
Säljarbete och kundansvar
Erfarenhet av ledande roller såsom projektledare eller teamledare
Erfarenhet av strategiarbete kopplat mot digitaliseringsfrågor


Varför välja Sopra Steria


Fokus på kompetensutveckling och din personliga utveckling - vi kallar det för Power of Sharing, bl.a. genom våra Community inom Analytics.
Stark företagskultur - utsedda till Sveriges bästa arbetsplats av Great Place to Work.
Europas ledande konsultbolag inom digitalisering med internationell närvaro.


Läs gärna mer om oss på Sopra Steria och vår satsning inom Analytics HÄR

Ansökan

Nu vill vi gärna höra lite om dig! Ansök enkelt genom att antingen ladda upp ditt CV eller länka direkt till ditt LinkedIn-konto via annonsen på vår hemsida!

Vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer, skicka därför gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

Har du några frågor kring rollen eller Sopra Steria? Du är välkommen att kontakta:

Joakim Hellgren joakim.hellgren@soprasteria.com eller Svante Larsson svante.larsson2@soprasteria.com

Vi ser fram emot att få höra ifrån dig!

Ytterligare information

Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description


Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
Work close to the Product Manager and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies


Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


Passion for Data, people, and technology
At least 4+ years' hands-on work experience as Data engineer on GCP/modern cloud data platforms, or advanced analytics environments.
Experience in cloud technologies and infrastructure
Experience in GCP tools – DBT and Bigquery
Experience in different data formats (Parquet, Avro)
Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages (Python, Java or Scala)
Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
Experience in working with data visualization tools
Fluent in English both written and verbal
Advantage if you also have Business understanding of retail industry


Application deadline: 06-02-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: Data Analyst (CRM Specialist) - Temporary Role for 13 months
Description:
Company Description


Please note that this is an temporary role for 13 months**



Sales is a global function within the H&M brand, dedicated to growing and engaging our customer base while developing our sales channels. By integrating business and digital & tech expertise, Sales plays a crucial role in delivering our brand plan—elevating H&M through product, experience, and brand, offering aspirational fashion at unbeatable prices.

The Customer Activation unit in Sales aims to bring our brand direction to life through various touchpoints. Utilizing data and customer insights, we design plans to ensure a holistic customer experience, from communication to our membership program.

In the Insights and Development team, we are passionate about leveraging data to enhance customer relationships and drive business growth. As a CRM Specialist, you will shape our data-driven strategies and optimize our CRM toolbox.

Job Description

Position Overview

We seek a candidate with strong data analysis and insights skills. The ideal candidate will have a solid background in data analysis, strong business acumen, and a passion for analyzing customer data, extracting meaningful insights, and leveraging those insights to drive CRM strategies and tactics. You will work closely with cross-functional global teams to extract insights from customer data, develop future use cases, and drive business growth through our CRM toolbox.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze customer data to identify trends, patterns, and business opportunities for CRM strategy improvements.
Collaborate with the global CRM team and the Value Stream Activate to drive strategy work, customer journey automation, future CRM use cases, and hypotheses for A/B tests.
Business analysis-contribute to weekly, monthly and quarterly follow up on business performance from a CRM and customer data perspective.
Follow-up of global triggered customer journeys and leverage these insights in journey optimization.
Guide the regions and serve as the point of contact for all CRM reports and KPIs.
Create and maintain data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Prioritize and develop CRM report package and other data products on GCP.



Qualifications


Academic degree in Business Administration, Economics, or a related field.
Previous experience in data analysis.
Genuine interest in creating business value from data.
Experience working with large data sets and complex business problems.
Proficiency in SQL.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and present findings to non-technical stakeholders.
A team player who enjoys sharing knowledge with colleagues.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a structured and thorough manner.



Preferred Qualifications


Previous experience working with customer data.
Business understanding within the field of CRM.
Experience with cloud analytics environments such as GCP.



If you are passionate about data, eager to make a difference, and thrive in a dynamic, data-driven environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Additional Information

This is a temporary position with placement in Stockholm in the Pegasus office. If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.

Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We look forward to receiving your application!

H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age. We strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Therefore, we kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases.

Kindly do not send applications to this email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.
Show more

Title: Business IT Analyst
Description:
Nord Group is seeking a Senior IT Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you’ll play a vital part in bridging the gap between business and IT, driving requirement engineering work.




About the Role

As a Senior IT Analyst, you’ll join the Requirements and Analysis team in the Open Banking Service Domain. Your focus will be on delivering actionable analyses to design innovative solutions that enhance customer experiences.




Key responsibilities include:

Partnering with stakeholders to align business strategies with practical, scalable technical solutions.
Gathering and documenting both functional and non-functional requirements through collaboration with teams like architecture, development, testing, and legal.
Breaking down business goals into actionable technical specifications for IT teams.
Ensuring smooth end-to-end development by maintaining clear requirements traceability.
Producing detailed documentation, including use cases, to support development and quality assurance.
Acting as a liaison for developers and testers, assisting with solution verification and test results analysis.
Providing key stakeholders with insights on solution performance and impact.




What We’re Looking For

We value adaptability, ownership, innovation, and resilience. Here’s what makes you a great fit:

A solid foundation in both technical and business domains, with strong analytical and documentation skills.
Self-motivation, attention to detail, and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Strong communication skills and a proven ability to collaborate in a team-oriented environment.
Familiarity with Agile approaches such as SAFe, Scrum, or Kanban.




Your Experience & Background

To succeed in this role, you should bring:

Relevant experience in IT or business analysis, with exposure to cross-functional projects.
Proficiency in tools like Jira and Confluence.
Knowledge of API development, process mapping, and data modeling.
Practical expertise in SQL, user interface design, and architectural diagrams (e.g., sequence diagrams).
An understanding of the banking sector, especially within payments.
Strong English language skills and experience working in international teams.




What's on Offer:

A competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities to contribute to transformative projects in the financial sector.
A hybrid working model, with flexibility across various European locations.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer (SQL/Python)
Description:
Nstart is one of Sweden’s top 15 largest fintech companies. We offer sustainable refinancing solutions to consumers, and we nudge them in the direction of debt freedom. We use advanced models and technical solutions with machine learning to generate deeper insights than what legacy banks and lenders can. We’re growing rapidly and expanding internationally.

We want to give everyone the opportunity of having a stable financial situation. Because sustainable household finances is the key to a stable economy and society. It is a great vision, but we are convinced that every human being can make a big difference. We, as well as our customers.

Our results speak clearly: We’ve already been highly successful in helping our clients improve their financial situations’, while creating strong value as a company and outperforming others. You’ll be joining us as a key person for the continued development of our modern data platform.

As a data engineer, you’ll be joining a fast-growing and profitable fintech player with co-workers who are true experts in their respective fields. People who are highly motivated, kind, and progressive. Joining a young and expanding company, you’ll find yourself in a situation where your work and effort will have huge impact on the future success of the company, while you’ll have endless opportunities to learn from others.

What You Will Do


Building and maintaining secure, scalable data pipelines for data ingestion and exposure (e.g., APIs) using Fivetran, Python and Lambdas.
Implementing and enforcing data quality standards across all workflows.
Translating business requirements into workable data models.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Data Science and Product team.


Experience


Strong programming skills in SQL and Python
Hands-on experience designing and developing data pipelines
Proven experience developing and integrating APIs.
Experience with dbt, Snowflake or any of the modern datawarehouses is highly desirable
Experience with any BI tool is good to have (OmniAnalytics, Looker, Tableau).


Who You Are


You enjoy finding simple solutions to complex problems
You take pride in the quality of your work
You are always curious, always learning
Your communication skills in English are excellent
You are open, curious with a willingness to contribute to the joint success of the team


Location in Stockholm.

Sounds good to you? We are looking forward to your application!
Show more
