Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Vi söker en driven Data Quality Analyst till området Data Quality inom Wholesale Solutions med inriktning på Spårbarhet.

Vi söker dig som brinner för masterdatafrågor och som har dokumenterad erfarenhet från tidigare arbete inom Masterdata där du haft en senior roll. Vidare tror vi att du har förståelse och intresse för datakvalitet och betydelsen av data i flödeskedjan tvärs organisationer samt förstår samspelet mellan verksamheten och IT-stöd. Du talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.

Som Data Quality Analyst är du driven och har lätt för att samarbeta och har förmågan att representera Data Quality i stora projekt som har påverkan på Masterdata inom ICA. Kompetens inom spårbarhetsområdet är önskvärt men inget krav.

Vi ser även att du använder självledarskapet i vardagen och är förändringsbenägen med ett fokus på att ständigt förbättra arbetssätt och processer.

Så här arbetar en Data Quaity Analyst

Förvalta, utveckla och säkerställa hög kvalitet i masterdataprocesser utifrån ett dataperspektiv samt de data assets som faller inom rollens ansvar.

I samarbete med verksamheten och Digital & Technology samla in och hantera krav för de tekniska och funktionella lösningar som återfinns inom ICAs masterdataprocesser.

Initiera förändringar och driva ständiga förbättringar av masterdatas dataprocesser och masterdatahantering.

Tillsammans med Data Quality Key User och Digital & Technology hantera avancerad felsökning och komplicerad utredning av incidenter gällande data assets, processer och verktyg.

Säkra att relevant dokumentation av dataprocess skapas och löpande underhålls, samt att kontinuerliga utbildningsåtgärder verkar för att tillgodose verksamhetens behov av kompetens inom masterdataområdet.

Tillföra hög masterdatakompetens i projekt och arbetsgrupper som kräver avancerad kompetens inom data och därmed säkra att förändrade eller nyutvecklade masterdataprocesser eller verktyg verkar för ”Best Practice” inom Masterdata Management.

Tillsammans med andra Masterdataexperter säkra effektivt utnyttjande av tillgängliga standarder och uppsatta policys för hantering av ICAs masterdata.

Via ett engagerat självledarskap och nyfikenhet verka för att rollens kompetens ligger i linje med ICAs aktuella behov på kort och lång sikt.

Vad händer nu?

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och tillträde till tjänsten sker enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande, så du är välkommen att skicka in din ansökan omgående. Vi reserverar oss för att tillsättning av tjänsten kan ske innan sista dagen för ansökan går ut.

Anställning:

Tillsvidare med tillträde snarast

Placeringsort:

Solna/Göteborg/Helsingborg

Kontaktperson:

Kajsa Fägerblad Area Manager Data Quality, ICA Sverige AB, tfn: +46722202154

Sista dag för ansökan:

2025-02-28

ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.
Show more

Title: Konsult inom Business Intelligence
Description:
Jobbeskrivning

Sopra Steria är mitt uppe i en spännande tillväxtresa och söker nu fler kollegor med erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence till vårt Analytics-team i Stockholm.

Inom Analytics tar vi oss an spännande, utvecklande och innovativa uppdrag där vi hjälper våra kunder på deras resa mot att bli datadrivna. Vi är en helhetsleverantör som stöttar våra kunder oavsett vart de är på sin resa, i allt från att definiera strategier för att bli mer datadrivna till att bygga DW-lösningar och visualiseringar i BI-verktyg till att leverera avancerade analyser med hjälp av tex AI/ML.

Om rollen

I rollen som Business Intelligence-konsult kommer du att bidra i något av våra spännande kunduppdrag. Vi har gedigen erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence och har nationellt ett team bestående av ett 50-tal erfarna stjärnor. Vi söker dig som vill bidra i allt från att hjälpa våra kunder definiera sina behov till att bygga grymma lösningar och agera som en trusted advisor och verkligen säkerställa att vi levererar rätt värde till kunden.

Om dig

För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har ett antal års erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence, där du har varit med i olika delar av processen för att framställa insikter av data, med hands-on erfarenhet. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet eller intresse av exempelvis affärsutveckling, sälj, kundansvar eller motsvarande. Har du tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult eller med cloudlösningar såsom Azure så är det ett plus.

Kompetenser:


Har en relevant högskoleutbildning
Minst tre års erfarenhet inom området för Business Intelligence, exempelvis: som DW-utvecklare/Data Engineer/Power BI utvecklare
Du har flytande språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


Meriterande, om du har erfarenheter av;


Erfarenhet inom Microsoft-stacken, exempelvis Power BI, MS SQL Server, Azure
Tidigare erfarenhet som konsult
Säljarbete och kundansvar
Erfarenhet av ledande roller såsom projektledare eller teamledare
Erfarenhet av strategiarbete kopplat mot digitaliseringsfrågor


Varför välja Sopra Steria


Fokus på kompetensutveckling och din personliga utveckling - vi kallar det för Power of Sharing, bl.a. genom våra Community inom Analytics.
Stark företagskultur - utsedda till Sveriges bästa arbetsplats av Great Place to Work.
Europas ledande konsultbolag inom digitalisering med internationell närvaro.


Läs gärna mer om oss på Sopra Steria och vår satsning inom Analytics HÄR

Ansökan

Nu vill vi gärna höra lite om dig! Ansök enkelt genom att antingen ladda upp ditt CV eller länka direkt till ditt LinkedIn-konto via annonsen på vår hemsida!

Vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer, skicka därför gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

Har du några frågor kring rollen eller Sopra Steria? Du är välkommen att kontakta:

Joakim Hellgren joakim.hellgren@soprasteria.com eller Svante Larsson svante.larsson2@soprasteria.com

Vi ser fram emot att få höra ifrån dig!

Ytterligare information

Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Lead, Corporate & Investment Banking | SEB, Stockholm
Description:
Would you like to help SEB Corporate & Investment Banking (CIB) division to reach our aspiration of becoming data driven and create value and insights from data? Are you excited about the process of creating and managing data and using it for Analytics and insights? Do you have the skills to work hands on with data while seeing the bigger picture, setting the strategic direction and actively work towards it? We are now looking for a Data Analyst Lead to join CIB Data and Analytics Office.

CIB Data & Analytics Office is a department within CIB CIO, driving dialogue with SEB Group, Analytics, and IT teams. We support new capabilities like cloud technology, data management & analytics toolkit, process digitalization and regulatory initiatives.

Master Data and Analytics Office is a team within CIB Data & Analytics Office with the mission to leverage the value in data and helping CIB becoming data driven by making sure high-quality data is available and used to create value for the business and our customers.

About the role:

This is a great opportunity to combine your analytic skills with people management and leadership skills. You will collaborate with stakeholders from all parts of SEB to make sure that short-term and long-term objectives are met.

Key responsibilities:


Collaborate with business units to provide data visualization and insights.
Analyze data to improve process efficiency.
Assist in gathering and structuring data for projects.
Develop analytical capabilities, reports, and validations.
Involve in the entire data value chain.
Promote the use of high-quality data.
Lead and mentor team members e.g. priorities, drive use cases and secure operational structure.
Coordinate and lead an analytics community within Master Data Area.


To thrive in this role, we believe you have:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or equivelent.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, BigQuery, Tableau, Excel, or similar tools.
Strong analytical skills to turn data into actionable insights.
Ability to simplify complex questions and work with stakeholders.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, especially BigQuery, is a plus.
Knowledge of business development processes and the financial sector.
Ability to bridge IT and business.
Strong personal drive and change leadership experience.
Excellent collaboration, communication, and presentation skills.
Fluency in English.
Proven leadership skills to inspire and guide teams.
Strong interpersonal skills for effective relationships.
Experience in leading and mentoring teams.
Ability to drive data literacy and best practices.
Strong decision-making and multitasking abilities.
Commitment to continuous improvement.


What we offer:

SEB CIB offers an attractive and international learning environment. We aim to attract exceptional individuals with a desire to grow their own skillset as well as provide exceptional service to their clients. You will work side by side with a diverse team of experienced colleagues and get the chance to build strong network internally as well as externally.

Do you want to be part of SEB?

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 20 February 2025. Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to Data and Analytics Office and our mission of making CIB data driven.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Stephanie Crane, Head of Master Data and Analytics Office & Data Transformation on +46 70 739 11 78 or stephanie.crane@seb.se . We will not process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.

https://sebgroup.com/career

https://bit.ly/SEBcareer
Show more

  • Proficiency in SQL, Python, BigQuery, Tableau, Excel, or similar tools.
  • Strong analytical skills to turn data into actionable insights.
  • Ability to simplify complex questions and work with stakeholders.
  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform, especially BigQuery, is a plus.
  • Knowledge of business development processes and the financial sector.
  • Ability to bridge IT and business.
  • Strong personal drive and change leadership experience.
  • Excellent collaboration, communication, and presentation skills.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Proven leadership skills to inspire and guide teams.
  • Strong interpersonal skills for effective relationships.
  • Experience in leading and mentoring teams.
  • Ability to drive data literacy and best practices.
  • Strong decision-making and multitasking abilities.
  • Commitment to continuous improvement.

What we offer:

SEB CIB offers an attractive and international learning environment. We aim to attract exceptional individuals with a desire to grow their own skillset as well as provide exceptional service to their clients. You will work side by side with a diverse team of experienced colleagues and get the chance to build strong network internally as well as externally.

Do you want to be part of SEB?

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 20 February 2025. Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to Data and Analytics Office and our mission of making CIB data driven.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Stephanie Crane, Head of Master Data and Analytics Office & Data Transformation on +46 70 739 11 78 or stephanie.crane@seb.se . We will not process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.

https://sebgroup.com/career

https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

Title: Informationsarkitekt - Data & Analytics
Description:
Arbetsuppgifter


Utveckla begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller
Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance


Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. När du tar initiativ, vågar utmana, prova nytt och utveckla vår verksamhet kommer du också att utvecklas. Det händer att våra medarbetare växer ur sin roll och kliver in i en annan. På så sätt blir din drivkraft utvecklingsmöjligheter både för dig och för oss. Låter det bra? Välkommen!

Att jobba som Informationsarkitekt

Som Informationsarkitekt hos Data & Analytics kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att bygga och förädla den grund som vår data- och informationshantering vilar på. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi organiserar och strukturerar vår information, vilket är avgörande för vår förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut och skapa värde för våra kunder. Genom att utveckla avancerade begrepps-, informations- och datamodeller, samt leda workshops och analyser, kommer du att säkerställa att vi har en tydlig och effektiv informationsstruktur. Ditt arbete med att skapa och underhålla dokumentation samt ansvara för masterdata och relaterade processer kommer att vara centralt för vår Data & analytics-avdelning. Dessutom kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i vårt arkitekturstyrningsarbete och fungera som en drivande kraft i implementeringen av vår Data governance-strategi.

Om detta låter intressant, då är det dags att bli en del av vårt team! SBAB välkomnar dig till en växande Data & analytics-avdelning. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

Vi ser gärna att du:


Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.


Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Har du check på allt?


Analytisk
Helhetsperspektiv
Initiativtagande
Kommunikativ
Strukturerad


Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.
Show more

Title: SQL Database Developer
Description:
Xensam: SAM Disrupters

Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.




We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.




About the role

As our Database Developer at Xensam, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of our company's databases. You will work closely with our development and operations teams, providing support and guidance to optimize our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, as well as implementing efficient data models.




The ideal candidate is passionate about database management, possesses at least 3-5 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, and thrives in an environment that values freedom of work and the ability to get things done.




Responsibilities

You will take ownership by maintaining and managing our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, performing routine database administration tasks, such as database monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization. You will also collaborate with development and operations teams to design and implement efficient database structures and schemas. Other responsibilities that you will have:

Engage in database concept refinement, data modeling, and the fine-tuning of SQL queries for optimal system performance.
Monitor database performance and proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues, including query optimization and data consistency problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enforce database standards and best practices.
Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in SQL and database administration.




Qualifications

3-5 years of professional experience working with databases.
Strong proficiency in SQL/PostgreSQL database administration and performance tuning.
Excellent understanding of database concepts, data modeling, and SQL query optimization.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex database-related issues.
Proven ability to work independently, take ownership of projects, and meet deadlines.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong proficiency in written and spoken English and Swedish.




Bonus points for

SQL/PostgreSQL certification (e.g., SQL/PostgreSQL Certified Professional) is a plus.
Experience with other database technologies, such as Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle Database, MongoDB etc.
Experience in the field of software licensing generally, or Software Asset Management specifically.




What you get

A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.




At Xensam, our core values define our culture

Rebellious: We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.

Humane: We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

Harmonious: We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.

Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!




As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Gillar du att arbeta med data och vara i framkant gällande nya datatjänster? Då är det här rätt tjänst för dig!

Om tjänsten

Till Ving söker vi en Data Engineer som gillar data, att lära sig nytt och kan utveckla vår dataplattform vidare i Microsoft Azure/Fabric.

Informationen från dataplattfomen på NLTG är strategiskt viktig i flera beslutsprocesser och används inom finans, commercial, marknad m.fl.

Teamet ansvarar för hela kedjan från krav, utveckling, test och leverans till förvaltning och support.

Det viktigaste för oss är inte vilka tekniker du kan idag utan det allra viktigaste är din inställning, nyfikenhet och viljan att lära nytt och bidra till vår utveckling och vår kultur.

Vem vi sökerVi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:



Erfarenhet som Data Engineer/BI utvecklare/DW utvecklare
Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure
Är nyfiken, analytisk och lyhörd för ny teknik
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i DevOps team inkl. CI/CD
Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning
Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


Vår plattform idag

Vi har en blandad teknikstack där nästan alla historiska MS Business Intelligence-plattformar finns representerade. SSIS, SSAS, masterdatasystem och SSRS har migrerats till molnet (Azure) med lift and shift. Vi har även nybyggda delar i Azure Synapse Analytics med notebooks innehållande SQL och Python. Nu står vi inför en resa bort från de äldre teknikerna och in i Microsoft Fabric.

Det är meriterande om du även:



Arbetat med/har intresse för Microsoft Fabric


Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du är nyfiken, analytisk och bra på att kommunicera. Du är en teamspelare som värdesätter teamet och bidrar till teamets framgång. I vårt team har vi en öppen dialog och samarbetar gärna kring lösningar och delar erfarenheter med varandra.

Vi erbjuder

Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö och vi sitter på Kungsholmen i centrala Stockholm med goda kommunikationer. Hos oss får du som anställd unika reseförmåner då vi tycker det är viktigt att du ska få se den produkt som du arbetar med. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!

Övrigt

Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när arbetet tillåter. I den här tjänsten tillämpas beredskap. Våra fina lokaler ligger på Vings huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm.

Intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Och har du ingen färdig ansökan och det är det som står i vägen? Hör av dig ändå med några korta rader, så reder vi ut detaljerna senare.

Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Daniel Dandemar på daniel.dandemar@nltg.com eller mobil: 0709-51 34 70

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Globetrotter, Ving Norge, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.

Vi är ett företag där vi har roligt och bryr oss om varandra med vårt people promise "it should be fun, developing and rewarding doing a good job".

Arbetsområde

IT

Roll: Development

Platser: Stockholm

Remote status

Hybridarbete

Sista ansökningsdag: 8 mars 2025

Kontaktperson: Daniel Dandemar
Show more

IT

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Northmill Bank is a pioneering financial institution at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience, digital yet personal.

Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 170 employees in 4 countries, 2.500 merchants and 600.000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a 100% cloud-based product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products.

Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey!

About Our Tech Stack



Snowflake
DBT
AWS
Fivetran
ThoughtSpot



About The Role

As a Data Engineer at Northmill Bank you will be part of the entire data lifecycle, from extracting raw data from its sources, loading it into Snowflake and then transforming/modeling the data to fit final business requirements. You will be a part of the cross-functional Credit & Analytics team consisting of Data Scientists and Analysts who serve the whole bank in terms of data for insights, predictive modeling, reporting and all other potential use cases.

Responsibilities



Collaborate on building and maintaining our full ELT pipeline, including connecting to various data sources using custom AWS Lambdas and/or Fivetran connectors.
Utilize DBT to model and transform data, ensuring it's clean, structured, and ready for analysis, reporting and other operational systems.
Continuously monitor and optimize data flows to proactively drive us forward.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in data engineering.



Qualifications



2+ years of experience in a data engineering role
Proficiency in SQL/Snowflake, DBT and Python.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Experience with cloud platforms, especially AWS, is a plus.
Have an interest in the underlying business and it’s data needs.



Fun Facts



Work-life balance - hit the gym two minutes away or go for a jog in the city.
Event - highly appreciated “Northchill”
Health - 5000 kr health care allowance
Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday.
Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office.
Stockholm's most beautiful office space, right in the city center with incredible views and our very own roof top terrace.



Apply today and be a part of Northmill!

Northmill is a tech company with a banking license aiming to improve financial life, offer merchants smart solutions and erase the borders between in-store and online.

Northmill creates a more personal and relevant experience for people and companies, helping more than 2,500 merchants and 600,000 end users.

Saved for users 31 MSEK

Trustpilot 4.6 of 5

Cloud 100 %

End users 600 000
Show more

Responsibilities


  • Collaborate on building and maintaining our full ELT pipeline, including connecting to various data sources using custom AWS Lambdas and/or Fivetran connectors.
  • Utilize DBT to model and transform data, ensuring it's clean, structured, and ready for analysis, reporting and other operational systems.
  • Continuously monitor and optimize data flows to proactively drive us forward.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in data engineering.


Qualifications


  • 2+ years of experience in a data engineering role
  • Proficiency in SQL/Snowflake, DBT and Python.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Experience with cloud platforms, especially AWS, is a plus.
  • Have an interest in the underlying business and it’s data needs.


Fun Facts


  • Work-life balance - hit the gym two minutes away or go for a jog in the city.
  • Event - highly appreciated “Northchill”
  • Health - 5000 kr health care allowance
  • Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday.
  • Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office.
  • Stockholm's most beautiful office space, right in the city center with incredible views and our very own roof top terrace.


Apply today and be a part of Northmill!

Northmill is a tech company with a banking license aiming to improve financial life, offer merchants smart solutions and erase the borders between in-store and online.

Northmill creates a more personal and relevant experience for people and companies, helping more than 2,500 merchants and 600,000 end users.

Saved for users 31 MSEK

Trustpilot 4.6 of 5

Cloud 100 %

End users 600 000

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Join the team as a Data Engineer and have high degree of impact on the Toptracer data platform




WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?




Our mission is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ⛳️ 📺 🎥




At our new office, you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating an environment where you can grow professionally and individually. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! 🥳 🏓 ☕️




We are proud to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! 🚀 💻 💙




THE ROLE

We are expanding our Shared Data team with a dedicated Data Engineer. This role offers the opportunity to actively contribute to the architecture and design of our data platform, influencing how data is utilized across the company. Your primary responsibilities will involve coding in Python, integrating new data into our data warehouse, and delivering high-quality data solutions to both internal and external customers.




This position provides the unique advantage of working on diverse projects across various teams, helping them derive insights to enhance their products. You will also have the opportunity to see your work in action by testing product changes - whether it’s analyzing results or even swinging a golf club.




You are someone who quickly adapts to new technologies and enjoys applying the right tools to tackle complex tasks. With an open mind, you evaluate multiple solutions, balancing their pros and cons. We believe you are passionate about coding, problem-solving, and understanding the requirements of data-driven analysis and services. You thrive in delivering end-to-end solutions, taking a project from concept to a fully functional system.




If you’re eager to join a dynamic team that values innovation, collaboration, and impactful work, we’d love to hear from you!




TECH STACK

Python | PostgreSQL

(required)




AWS | RabbitMQ | Kafka | Redshift | dbt | Airflow

(knowledge of at least a few, but proficiency in all not required)




POSSIBILITIES

Innovate to make golf more accessible
High degree of impact on the Toptracer data platform
Broad range of technology and development opportunities
Close collaboration with multiple teams and products
Working in an agile environment




WE BELIEVE YOU HAVE

4+ years of experience working as a software engineer with focus on data
3+ years of experience working in Python
Experience in working in a cloud infrastructure, preferably AWS
Experience in building ETL/ELT pipelines
Experience with a warehouse solution, preferably Redshift




MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER




Workplace




We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.




In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.




Culture

Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence.




Activities

After-work
Pair/Mob programming
Conference
Dart
Gym sessions
Table-tennis
Golf simulator
Golf tournaments




Benefits

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
Professional development and growth opportunities.
A hybrid work environment with the primary workplace at our cozy and welcoming office in Mörby Centrum, Danderyd.
And of course, play golf!




The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

Title: Database Engineer
Description:
Do you aim to have a dynamic impact on the world?

Do you want to go beyond what’s possible?

Are you up for creating solutions and solving tomorrow’s problems today?

Then we have the opportunity for you!

We are looking for an exceptionally talented database engineer to help tackle some of the most complex problems in the world and drive a revolutionary transformation in the field of logistics. We are specifically looking for individuals already proven their skills in designing and constructing large, intricate systems that are also easily maintainable.

Airmee is a well-capitalized start-up backed by some of Sweden’s leading investors. As one of Europe's fastest growing logistics startups, we specialize in fast and convenient deliveries for retailers and businesses. Our cutting-edge technology, developed through extensive research at KTH, enables us to optimize our logistics fleet in real-time, delivering superior cost-efficiency and environmental sustainability.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for a Database Engineer to join our team responsible for internationally scaling the services offered by Airmee. As a Database Engineer, you will play a vital role in designing and developing databases, as well as optimizing our infrastructure to efficiently handle growing data loads.

Our AWS Lambda (NodeJS and Python) APIs are connected to AWS RDS (PostgreSQL) instances. The entire system infrastructure is hosted on AWS.

Proficiency in test-driven development is a must, as we strive for comprehensive test coverage of 100%. We place strong emphasis on well-documented and readable code, so we expect you to write clean code and document it thoroughly.

You should be comfortable working with staging and production environments, ensuring smooth transitions between the two.

You have considerable experience maintaining and scaling up databases, in particular on indexing databases and managing connection pooling and latency.

At Airmee, we appreciate a strong work ethic, and we believe in fostering a positive and collaborative environment that encourages growth and success. Join us on our mission to reshape the logistics industry and make a lasting impact on the world.

Skills & Requirements

We believe that you have:


a minimum of 5 years of experience managing large scale relational databases
experience working with database multi tenancy
experience working with large scale database indexing, database replication and high availability databases
experience working with caches in front of databases for load offsetting
have experience handling PostgreSQL instances hosted on AWS RDS
Monitor and optimize database performance using indexing, query tuning, and caching.
Optimize database performance and monitor using AWS CloudWatch and Performance Insights.


It will be amazing if you also,


have at least one project on a public repository (any sharable repository would work)
experience working with Serverless technology, ideally on AWS Lambdas that make use of database connections
you are a contributor to the open source community
Perform backup and recovery strategies using pg_dump, pg_basebackup, and WAL archiving.


Why join us?

At our company, you'll have the chance to collaborate with a diverse group of highly skilled, motivated, and fascinating colleagues. We value efficiency and excellence, always striving to outperform others, all while having fun and enjoying the process of problem-solving.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist - Data Modeling
Description:
Please not that working proficiency in Swedish language is required.




Är du riktigt vass på BI Utveckling / Data Modeling samt älskar att resa på fritiden?
Vill du bidra till att skapa den bästa kundresan & reseupplevelsen för våra kunder?
Vill du arbeta i en familjär, varm och omtänksam företagskultur ihop med dedikerade och riktigt kompetenta medarbetare?







Då är rollen som Senior BI Developer med inriktning Data Modeling på Apollo som klippt och skuren för dig, läs gärna vidare!




Apollo söker nu en erfaren BI-utvecklare till vårt datalagerteam, med fokus på datamodellering och SQL-utveckling i vår Azure Databricksmiljö. Den ideala kandidaten är avgörande för att utforma och implementera både kärndatalagermodeller och dimensionella modeller för våra rapporteringsmarknader




Bakgrund

För Apollo är utveckling lika viktigt som Grekland och världen. Att utveckla tjänster och produkter som ger våra slutkunder den bästa upplevelsen, innan, under och efter resan är ständigt i fokus för oss. Just nu arbetar vi med att byta ut vårt CMS och PIM till Contentful, samtidigt bygger vi en tydligare struktur där både utvecklare och produktägare ges än större befogenheter och ansvar för vår plattform. 85% av Apollos försäljning sker online och vi lägger stor vikt vid att kontinuerligt förbättra kundupplevelsen genom att driva innovation som hjälper våra kunder att hitta, konfigurera och beställa sin drömresa




Våra utvecklingsteam tillsammans med våra produktägare och UX designers driver gemensamt utvecklingen av sitt område framåt, både på produktnivå såväl som tekniskt. Vi arbetar nära övriga avdelningar för att säkerställa att vi på bästa sätt nyttjar den långa och breda erfarenhet vi som organisation har om de resor vi e

rbjuder.Tjänsteplacering kommer att vara på huvudkontoret på Ynglingagatan i Stockholm, här sitter ca 170 av våra medarbetare varav 50 av dessa jobbar inom IT.




Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden

+5 års erfarenhet av nedan, gärna mer
Designa och implementera datamodeller för vårt kärnlager av datalager, med fokus på att integrera data från flera källor
Utveckla Star-schemamodeller för dataförråd som matas in i Power BI-rapporter, vilket säkerställer optimal prestanda och användbarhet
Skriva effektiva och optimerade SQL-frågor för datatransformation och analys
Samarbeta med affärsintressenter för att förstå rapporteringskrav och översätta dem till effektiva datamodeller
Underhålla och förbättra befintliga datamodeller för att säkerställa skalbarhet, prestanda och anpassning till affärsprocesser
Hjälpa till med utveckling och optimering av ETL-processer
Bidra till dokumentationen av data härkomst, styrning och affärsregler




Nödvändiga färdigheter

Stark SQL-kunskap
Stark erfarenhet av datamodellering, särskilt av att utforma normaliserade modeller för kärndatalager och star-scheman för rapportering av marts
Gedigen förståelse för datalagringskoncept och best-practice
Utmärkt analytisk och problemlösande förmåga




Meriterande färdigheter

Kunskaper om Azure Databricks och/eller notebook-drivna miljöer
Erfarenhet av utveckling av Power BI-rapporter
Kunskap om Python eller andra programmeringsspråk som används inom dataanalys




Personlighet

Då utvecklingsteamen arbetar verksamhetsnära är förmågan till goda relationer samt stort intresse för övriga delar av Apollo viktigt. Apollo andas och lever tillsammans, lagandan är tydlig och man utmanar gärna varandra positivt för att nå framgång. Branschen och Apollo är snabbrörliga, agila och så även du. Vidare är du en nyfiken social och kreativ lagspelare, kompetent, kommunikativ och stolt över ditt yrkeskunnande. Du delar med dig av din kunskap, är bra på att ge och ta konstruktiv feedback samt mån om att arbeta med kontinuerlig förbättring av såväl dig själv som verksamheten.




Vårt erbjudande

Apollo erbjuder en stimulerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö med varierande arbetsuppgifter som du har stor möjlighet att påverka. Vi har en platt organisation som uppmuntrar samarbete, kommunikation och delande av idéer inom och mellan olika avdelningar på Apollo. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där affären är viktigt samtidigt som vi har roligt och en bra balans mellan jobb och privatliv. Frågar vi våra utvecklare så beskrivs vi som en organisation där du uppmanas och har utrymme att lyfta idéer kring hemsidan eller teknikval. Vi ser också till att faktiskt testa nya tekniker vilket gör att vi ständigt utvecklas och utmanas, tillsammans i teamen! Utöver detta kommer du givetvis att erbjudas riktigt bra deals på resor utöver redan schyssta förmåner.




Kontakt & Ansökan

Idenna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Aliby - The Pink Company. Då intervjuer och urval sker löpande ber vi dig att inte vänta med att skicka in ditt CV. Vid intresse vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult. Omar Burazerovic på 0728897441




Om Oss

Apollo är en branschledande researrangör som underlättat för skandinaver att komma ut i världen, först med resor till Grekland till att nu kunna erbjuda hela världen till våra kunder. Vi gör det genom vårt charterbolag Apollo, men även genom våra systerbolag Xtravel, Golf Plaisir, Out of Bounds och Lime Travel. Med mer än 35 år i branschen så fortsätter vi att växa och söker därför efter fler kompetenta IT-medarbetare som tillsammans med oss vill skapa resebranschens bästa kundresa, oavsett om den sker digitalt eller på en sandstrand i Grekland. Sedan 2015 är Apollo en del av den privatägda tyska koncernen REWE med över 300 000 medarbetare. REWE är stora inom dagligvaruhandel, sällanköp, reseindustrin, med mera. En stark ägare som även har fler andra resebolag i Europa inom koncernen som vi samarbetar med.

Vi gör det genom vårt charterbolag Apollo, men även genom våra systerbolag Xtravel, Golf Plaisir, Out of Bounds och Lime Travel. Med mer än 35 år i branschen så fortsätter vi att växa och söker därför efter fler kompetenta IT-medarbetare som tillsammans med oss vill skapa resebranschens bästa kundresa, oavsett om den sker digitalt eller på en sandstrand i Grekland. Sedan 2015 är Apollo en del av den privatägda tyska koncernen REWE med över 300 000 medarbetare. REWE är stora inom dagligvaruhandel, sällanköp, reseindustrin, med mera. En stark ägare som även har fler andra resebolag i Europa inom koncernen som vi samarbetar med.

Title: BI-utvecklare, Stockholm
Description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten

Är du intresserad av en roll inom Business Intelligence-området där du får möjlighet att leverera i en komplex Data Warehouse-lösning? Vill du bli en del av ett av Sveriges härligaste BI-team och samtidigt bli erbjuden en trygg anställning där du får utvecklas? Då är denna tjänst helt rätt för dig!

Vi utökar nu ett av våra team inom Data Warehouse med fler erfarna BI-utvecklare. Du kommer att ingå i ett växande team för att hjälpa en av våra bankkunder med sina Data Warehouse-lösningar.

Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter

I den här leveransen kommer du designa och implementera BI-lösningar med hjälp av SQL, SSIS och Cognos. En central del av rollen innebär att utveckla och underhålla dataflöden och ETL-processer samt skapa och underhålla datamodeller och rapporteringslösningar. Du kommer också använda dig av SSAS (kuber).

En viktig del av vårt åtagande till kunden är att hantera och utveckla rapportering utifrån regulatoriska krav, till olika myndigheter. Vi ser det därför som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av bank och/eller annan kunskap om finansiella instrument eller ekonomi.

Du blir en del av vår BI-community, där du får chansen att både hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom Business Intelligence och att dela med dig av dina egna kunskaper. Vi erbjuder även utbildning och support till kunder i BI-verktyg och teknologier.

Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll

Eftersom våra kunder och dokumentationen du kommer få arbeta med är på svenska, så är ett krav för denna tjänst god kommunikationsförmåga i svenska, både i tal och i skrift.

Utöver detta ser vi gärna att du har:


Minst 5 års erfarenhet av rollen som BI-utvecklare
Kunskap i SQL och erfarenhet av SSIS och Cognos
Erfarenhet av datawarehousing och datamodellering


Då våra kunder primärt är inom bank och finans är det meriterande med erfarenhet från banksektorn.

Som person är du trygg i din yrkesroll, ansvarsfull och noggrann. Du är självgående i ditt arbete och trivs både med att arbeta individuellt och i team. Utöver detta ser vi att du är en person som är nyfiken och initiativtagande när det kommer till att lösa problem och du delar med dig av dina kunskaper och best practice.

Vill du veta mer?

Vad roligt! Kontakta då gärna mig, Anna Osterman, som är rekryterande chef för denna roll. Du når mig på anna.osterman@cgi.com, 0761 01 31 13.Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

Ansökningarna hanteras löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan i dag! Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?

Vi är mer än du tror - Vi är ett globalt företag där det finns flera möjligheter än att vara konsult och där work-life balance uppmuntras. Hos oss kan du jobba med våra egna produkter, Inhouse eller ute hos kund. Var du än befinner dig i livet finns det möjligheter för dig på CGI. Det som gör oss unika är att vi lyckas vara både globala och lokala på samma gång. Vi väljer att kalla det för ”Glocal:” Vad det faktiskt innebär är att det bästa ur två världar kombineras. Det globala sammanhanget och stabiliteten finns, samtidigt som varje kontor bygger sin personliga kultur med trivsel och välmående i fokus.

Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:


Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön
Föräldralön: Vi betalar ut minst 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma
Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag om 4 000 kr
Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar
Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar
Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI


Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se

Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.

Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.

Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.

Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.

Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.

Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role


Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies


Essential Requirements


Passion for Data, people, and technology
At least 4+ year’s work experience including hands-on as either:
Data engineer on modern cloud data platforms /or advanced analytics environments.
Software Engineer with cloud technologies and infrastructure
Experience in different data formats (Avro, Parquet)
Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
Experience in working with data visualization tools
Fluent in English both written and verbal


Meritorious


Experience in GCP tools – Dataflow, Dataproc and Bigquery
Experience in data processing framework – Beam, Spark, Hive, Flink
Business understanding of retail industry


Please explain how you meet all the requirements when applying.

Utilization: 100%

Location: Stockholm

Period: 08-04-2025-30-09-2025

Last day to apply: 06-02-2025

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst - Copenhagen:




Are you a data-driven problem solver with a passion for turning numbers into insights?

Do you thrive in a collaborative team and love working with stakeholders to drive real business impact?




I am looking for a data driven problem solver to join a dynamic workforce and help them on their digitalization journey.

Joining the business development team means you are a key point of contact for our internal stakeholders - helping to bring new business value through detailed reports.




Your goal? Bring data to the forefront of the business!




Role and Responsibilities:




Play a forward role within the business, helping to achieve strategic goals by leveraging data
Define, design and deliver advanced reporting through Power BI
Using your analytical mindset to find new value from the data
Collaborate with the Data & Analytics Manager to become the key point of contact for internal stakeholders




Key Skills Required:




Previous experience in an analytical or data focused environment
Hands on experience with Power BI and reporting
Strong work ethic as an individual or in a team
Self-starter mentality with confidence in their own ability to solve data focused problems
Fluency in Danish and English




Alongside your Danish counterparts, this business has a large collaboration with a larger team in Sweden.

Cross collaboration on projects is not only expected but promoted.




If you are looking to kick-start your career with a data driven position in a team that wants to see you thrive - then here it is!




d.nichol@tenthrevolution.com

Show more

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data and business analysis? We are currently looking for a Commercial Data Analyst to support our commercial teams and commercial management. This is a great opportunity to join Kahoot! - One of the world's fastest moving SaaS companies and be part of an exciting growth journey!

At Kahoot!, we believe in people, we believe in pushing boundaries, both for ourselves and for our customers. We challenge the status quo, and that is why both customers and colleagues value us so highly, making us one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in the world.

Our job is to inspire and challenge our customers every day to discover new opportunities, leveraging our platforms and driving world-class employee engagement, learning and communication.

The Commercial Data Analyst reports to the Sales Operations Manager. The position can be located in Copenhagen, Denmark or Oslo, Norway.


About Kahoot!

The Kahoot! Group is on a mission to make learning awesome! We want to empower everyone, including children, students, and employees to unlock their full learning potential. Our Kahoot! learning platform makes it easy for any individual or corporation to create, share, and host learning sessions that drive compelling engagement.

Launched in 2013, Kahoot!'s vision is to build the leading learning platform in the world. Since launch, Kahoot! has hosted hundreds of millions of learning sessions with more than 10 billion participants (non-unique) in more than 200 countries and regions. The Kahoot! Group includes Clever, the leading US K-12 EdTech learning platform, together with the learning apps DragonBox, Poio, Drops, Actimo, Motimate, and Whiteboard.fi.

The Kahoot! Group is headquartered in Oslo, Norway, with offices in the US, the UK, France, Finland, Estonia, Denmark, Spain and Poland. To learn more, visit us at kahoot.com, and let's play!


Our K!rew

At the Kahoot! Group we champion a positive culture of collaborative learning and innovation. With a global team of more than 600 employees representing over 50 different nationalities, we're a diverse and fun bunch of people! We work hard and celebrate our wins, tackle challenges with original ideas and learn something new every day.

We are driven by our mission and guided by our values: playful, curious and inclusive.  

If you talk to anyone working in the Kahoot! Group, they will tell you that one of the greatest perks is being able to see how the work you do puts a smile on the face of kids, teachers and learners all around the world. 


Responsibilities

The Data Analyst 's main responsibility shall be to provide support across all areas of the business. The role will be providing the commercial teams and management with the proactive actionable insights they need to make the right decision so that we can make a positive impact on learning in classrooms and workplaces worldwide.


Make actionable recommendations based on data insights to improve operations, enhance customer experience, or increase profitability
Build and maintain automated dashboards to visualize key metrics and performance trends to management and sales leadership teams
Working closely with the data engineering team responsible for our data analytics platform and Sales, Marketing and Customer Experience to understand their problems and provide them with actionable data analyses
Work closely with key members of the data team to build, maintain and improve reporting systems. This includes owning the quality and flow of commercial data to our data warehouse and the collection of new data. 
Collaborating with our CRM team to streamline processes and reporting across our CRM platform (HubSpot) and other relevant tools
Work with relevant teams to ensure seamless integration of data insights into sales processes
Own data quality from a commercial perspective, this includes established clear definitions, secure completeness, enhancement and enrichment of data, and regularly data wash
Develop and maintain key metrics to monitor commercial success and drive continuous improvement
Perform ad-hoc analysis, translate and communicate results to stakeholders



Requirements


A Bachelor or Master degree in a numerate or computing-related subject
+3 years experience in a similar position
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Possess a balanced blend of business acumen and IT expertise
Ability to visualise and interpret complex data sets
Solid project management skills to guide point-in-time and ongoing targeted data quality projects
Comprehensive understanding of the importance and impact of data (or bad data) on the ability of the business to meet its own objectives
Fluent using SQL
Experience using Python and Bash is an advantage
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Storage) is an advantage
Experience with Microsoft Power BI and or ThoughtSpot is an advantage



Benefits


A competitive compensation package
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Home broadband allowance
Mobile subscription
Lunch contribution
Hybrid work set up
Flexible working
Buddy program 
Social and company events (virtual and in person)
A diverse, friendly and international environment 
Modern office in central Copenhagen or Oslo
Show more

  • Solid project management skills to guide point-in-time and ongoing targeted data quality projects
  • Comprehensive understanding of the importance and impact of data (or bad data) on the ability of the business to meet its own objectives
  • Fluent using SQL
  • Experience using Python and Bash is an advantage
  • Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Storage) is an advantage
  • Experience with Microsoft Power BI and or ThoughtSpot is an advantage


Benefits

  • A competitive compensation package
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Home broadband allowance
  • Mobile subscription
  • Lunch contribution
  • Hybrid work set up
  • Flexible working
  • Buddy program 
  • Social and company events (virtual and in person)
  • A diverse, friendly and international environment 
  • Modern office in central Copenhagen or Oslo

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a global leader in premium lifestyle products, specializing in apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. The Global Customer Insights & Experience (CIX) team is seeking a motivated data analyst to support the integration and analysis of large customer data sets, focusing on understanding customer behaviour and interactions with global brands and labels.

Responsibilities:




Utilising the data extracted from data science teams and drawing out customer insights relating to different labels and brands.
Design and build data extracts, manipulations, and summarisations to address customer data questions.
Apply the best technical methodologies and approaches for analysing large data sets on SQL and Tableau.
Collaborate with various teams to deliver clear, actionable insights for global brands and labels.

Requirements:




2-3 years of data analyst experience, ideally from a consulting background.
Experience with large transactional and behavioural data sources.
Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, Dataiku, and Microsoft Office.
Strong communication skills with the ability to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Details:




Start date: ASAP
Location: Hybrid, 2 days per week in the London office
Salary: circa. £55k FTC
Duration: 12 months

HTML:
Our client is a global leader in premium lifestyle products, specializing in apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. The Global Customer Insights & Experience (CIX) team is seeking a motivated data analyst to support the integration and analysis of large customer data sets, focusing on understanding customer behaviour and interactions with global brands and labels.

Responsibilities:


  • Utilising the data extracted from data science teams and drawing out customer insights relating to different labels and brands.
  • Design and build data extracts, manipulations, and summarisations to address customer data questions.
  • Apply the best technical methodologies and approaches for analysing large data sets on SQL and Tableau.
  • Collaborate with various teams to deliver clear, actionable insights for global brands and labels.

Requirements:


  • 2-3 years of data analyst experience, ideally from a consulting background.
  • Experience with large transactional and behavioural data sources.
  • Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, Dataiku, and Microsoft Office.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Details:


  • Start date: ASAP
  • Location: Hybrid, 2 days per week in the London office
  • Salary: circa. £55k FTC
  • Duration: 12 months

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we turn dreams into stardom and audiences into fans. We are guided by three core values that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses:


Curiosity: We do our best work when we’re immersing ourselves in culture and breaking through barriers. Curiosity is the driving force behind creativity and ingenuity. It fuels innovation, and innovation is the key to our future.
Collaboration: Making music and bringing it to the world is all about the power of originality amplified by teamwork. A great idea, like a great song, travels globally. We ignite passions and build connections across our diverse community of artists, songwriters, partners, and fans.
Commitment: We pursue excellence for our team and our talent. Everything in music starts with a leap into the unknown, and we’re committed to keeping the faith, acting with integrity, and delivering on our promises.


We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sex or sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, and any other protected characteristic or identity.

Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.

Job Title: Junior Data Analyst, 12 Month Contract

A Little Bit About Our Team

Our team of 4 handles the processing and invoicing of Warner’s worldwide digital sales, as well as reporting these sales to our affiliates worldwide for onward royalty accounting to our artists. We work very closely with a number of other departments, namely IT, Royalties, Business Development, Business Affairs and Finance.

Why This Could Be Your Next Big Break

You’ll be responsible for loading the streaming & download sales we’ve received from our digital providers, like Spotify, iTunes/Apple Music, Tidal and Deezer – to eventually get paid through to our Artists. You’ll also be clearing through any errored transactions that have ended up in suspense, making sure our Artists receive all of the revenue for sales they’ve made. You’ll be working at your own pace and have the freedom to complete tasks in the way that works for you, and have plenty of support from the rest of the team.

Here You’ll Get To


Work with large sets of data, and develop skills to analyse and transform data sets of varying sizes, from small to huge.
Learn about databases, data structures, and digital sales transactions of our repertoire – and how we go from the sale of an album, single or stream through to getting the royalty paid to the artist, and how the pricing of each stream/download is calculated.
Talk with our labels and our worldwide affiliates to resolve any queries that may pop up, or with our digital streaming / download platforms.


About You


You have a high level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel, familiar with its built-in functions.
You have a self-driven attitude to work, able to set your own deadlines, work independently, and communicate professionally with any of our external customers.
You have an analytical mindset, with the ability to see the “bigger picture” within large sets of data.
You have strong attention to detail and are extremely thorough.
You have good, proven education credentials with subjects such as Maths, IT, Economics or English, and are able to understand basic economic concepts such as foreign exchange rates.
You have an open approach to work, and the ability to adapt to a rapidly changing, developing and moving environment.


It would be music to our ears if you also had:


Experience working with databases and large sets of data.
Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python, particularly the Pandas library.
A self-motivated candidate with good communication skills who can problem solve and find solutions.


About Us

As the home to Asylum, Atlantic, East West, Elektra, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Warner Music Group is also home to ADA, which supports the independent community, as well as artist services division WMX. In addition, WMG counts film and television storytelling powerhouse Warner Music Entertainment among its many brands.

Together, we are Warner Music Group: Independent Minds. Major Sound.

Love this job and want to apply?

Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.

Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.

Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We have a new opportunity to be part of the IT team in the role of Data Analyst to work on activities such as building dashboards and reports to present clear and insightful visuals to drive new insights and improve decision-making, ultimately contributing to the team’s primary objective of being a top three team in the FIA Constructor’s Championship.




You will be responsible for:

Working with stakeholders to understand their data requirements
Building pipelines to ingest data into the data lake
Designing, building and deploying dashboards and reports in Power BI
Performing data mapping and modelling
Developing and update technical documentation
Implementing and owning a BI Centre of Excellence and driving best practices, engagement and Power BI training and education within the departments
Advocating for, and ensuring adherence to data governance and security standards
Handling and overseeing data pipelines, automating data collection and integration from diverse sources, and interacting with API systems
Providing support to key departments to ensure critical dashboards and reports are always available




What you will need to be successful in this role:

Expert Power BI knowledge
Ability to take client requirements, understand them and turn them into a powerful story told through engaging visuals in Power BI
Experience working in an agile environment using Azure Dev Ops
Expert knowledge of SQL and TSQL
Purview or similar data governance tools is beneficial
Experience of designing and building data models using Data Analysis Expressions (DAX)
Hands-on experience with Azure tools: Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, SQL, Data Lake, Power BI, Delta Lake, and Spark.
Ability to design, build, and deploy interactive user interfaces for interrogating data
Experience of Power Automate would be beneficial
Experience with predictive analytics, Azure cognitive services, and AI.
Scripting skills in C# & Python (for statistical analysis and advanced analytics)
Eager to learn new technologies
Excellent verbal / written communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present and communicate technical designs
To be self-motivated and to motivate others to thrive in a challenging environment
Ability to calmly and confidently work under pressure to achieve targets and deliver results within required timescales
Microsoft certifications are a plus.




This is a full-time office-based role based at our campus in Silverstone, with additional requirement to travel to other locations where necessary.




Embark on a journey with the Aston Martin Aramco Formula One® Team to reshape history at our cutting-edge, sustainable campus in Northamptonshire. Combining our rich heritage with innovation, we bring fresh energy to the sport, driven by a commitment to challenge the status quo and dominate the track. With new investment fueling our ambitions, we're seeking talented individuals who share our passion for racing and drive for success. As part of our high-performing, collaborative team, you'll enjoy a competitive package, including a discretionary bonus scheme, private health care, pension plan, life assurance, and benefits like TEDSgroup childcare, cycle-to-work, tech, and car schemes. Plus, you can look forward to an on-site gym with fitness, spin, and yoga classes, as well as a new restaurant offering indoor and outdoor dining.




We are a business that fosters a supportive, inclusive, and compassionate culture, where our team genuinely embodies our core values: Growth, Readiness, Empowerment, Excellence, and Nurturing.




Aston Martin Formula One® Team is committed to attracting, recruiting, and retaining the most talented individuals, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy or maternity, race, religion, belief, sex or sexual orientation. We strive to be a Team that reflects all the communities with which we engage around the world through diversity in the workplace and promoting an inclusive culture in which all team members are respected, empowered and valued.




Aston Martin Aramco Formula One® Team is committed to making sure our selection methods are fair for all. If you would like to request that reasonable adjustments are made, please complete our Request for Reasonable Adjustments form here.

Title: Data & Visualisation Analyst
Description:
Who are OnBuy? 

OnBuy are an online marketplace who are on a mission of being the best choice for every customer, everywhere.  

We have recently been named one of the UK's fastest-growing tech companies in Deloitte's Technology Fast 50 for the third year in a row (as well as 'Fastest-Growing Tech Business in the South West'). 

All achievements we are very proud of, but we don't let that go to our head. We are all laser focused on our mission and understand the huge joint effort ahead of us needed to succeed. 

Working at OnBuy: 

We are a team of driven and motivated people who thrive when working at pace. To succeed at OnBuy you need to take charge and fully own your responsibilities, rolling your sleeves up when needed to 'get it done'. Working at OnBuy you are surrounded by so much opportunity, but you must possess the ability to stay focused and prioritise ruthlessly. Most importantly, you will thrive in an ever-changing environment as we are constantly evolving. 

At OnBuy, you're not just a number or another cog in a machine. We are creating something really special, and you have the opportunity to affect meaningful change and have your voice heard.  

We are a close team, who have the opportunity to learn and grow as OnBuy evolves. We work in a flexible way, meaning we can prioritise our health and relationships, but when we are working, we graft. 


Job Overview

We are seeking a data analyst to join our team. In this role, you will assist the Business Intelligence team by supporting with business commercial analysis and maintaining and improving our Looker Studio reporting suite

This is a fantastic opportunity for a data enthusiast looking to grow their career in analytics within a fast-paced and dynamic eCommerce environment. Our solutions are primarily built on the Google stack of which Looker Studio is our main BI reporting tool.


Your Role Will Involve:

Driving Business Value Through Data

Write and optimize SQL queries to extract insights from our databases
Use data strategically to identify opportunities that deliver measurable impact on business performance
Develop insights and actionable recommendations that align with business goals, empowering stakeholders to make informed decisions
Assist in tracking and reporting trading performance across our 14 new international sites

Looker Studio Reporting Suite Management

Maintain the company's Looker Studio reporting suite
Develop and automate new reports and dashboards as required
Ensure accurate and up-to-date reporting aligned with business needs

Efficiency and Cost-Effective Solutions

Identify opportunities to streamline data workflows and reporting processes, reducing overhead while maintaining quality
Champion cost-efficient solutions in reporting and analytics that maximize value without excessive resource use

Ownership and Execution

Take end-to-end ownership of tasks and projects, delivering results on time and to a high standard
Proactively identify challenges, propose solutions, and execute with minimal oversight




Requirements



Requirements

We're looking for someone who:

Holds a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related analytical field
Has 1 - 2 year prior experience in an analytics or reporting role
Have a strong grounding in statistics and aggregating information
Is confident working with SQL (e.g., MySQL or BigQuery)
Possesses a strong understanding of Looker Studio or other BI tools
Has excellent attention to detail and can ensure reporting accuracy
Is comfortable working with large datasets and able to extract key insights
Can communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Shows a willingness to learn and grow with the company



Desirable Skills

Knowledge of Google Analytics
Basic understanding of Python or other scripting languages
Familiarity with eCommerce data and metrics



Benefits



The salary on offer for this role is £35,000 to £45,000 per annum, depending on experience.


In return for helping us to grow, we'll offer you company equity, meaning you own a piece of this business we are all working so hard to build.
